results.title: OverDrawn
results.creator_credit: Martin Walch, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Martin Walch mixes the toxic beauty of his own photographs with industrial and geographic documentation in this animated pan across an area of the Mt Lyell mine, Tasmania.
results.description: Martin Walch mixes the toxic beauty of his own photographs with industrial and geographic documentation in this animated pan across an area of the Mt Lyell mine, Tasmania.
description_for_label: Martin Walch mixes the toxic beauty of his own photographs with industrial and geographic documentation in this animated pan across an area of the Mt Lyell mine, Tasmania.

results.title: Paper War
results.creator_credit: Guan Wei, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: This simple tracking shot along Guan Wei’s exquisitely drawn battle scenes, silhouetted against a traditional landscape scroll, suggests the right-to-left movement of Chinese reading.
results.description: This simple tracking shot along Guan Wei’s exquisitely drawn battle scenes, silhouetted against a traditional landscape scroll, suggests the right-to-left movement of Chinese reading.

results.creator_credit: Daniel von Sturmer, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Continuing from his ‘Truth Effect’ series, and the tradition of George MÃ©liÃ¨s, Daniel von Sturmer creates a miniature environment in which an everyday object behaves in unexpected ways.

results.title: Blurring the boundaries
results.creator_credit: Craig Walsh, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Repurposing documentation of his wild installation, where unexpected images are projected onto a shop window in Vietnam, Craig Walsh captures the interaction between art and its audience.

results.title: The Minemaker
results.creator_credit: Rod Kinnear, Conzinc Riotinto Australia and Rod Kinnear Productions
results.brief_description: This film describes the varied activities of CRA and its associates and subsidiary companies, including exploration, mining at Broken Hill, the Hammersley Iron project, financing and computer work, Comalco’s aluminium industry, Blair Athol coal, and copper mining on Bougainville.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rod Kinnear, Conzinc Riotinto Australia and Rod Kinnear Productions
results.description: This film describes the varied activities of CRA and its associates and subsidiary companies, including exploration, mining at Broken Hill, the Hammersley Iron project, financing and computer work, Comalco’s aluminium industry, Blair Athol coal, and copper mining on Bougainville.

results.title: Using a computer catalogue
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Jenny Craig, Keith Rees, Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Because of changing library information systems, computerised catalogues are increasingly being used to record, store and retrieve holdings in libraries. Ann Hannan demostrates how to use the OPAC (On Line Public Access Catalogue) System, which is a touch system used in public libraries.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Jenny Craig, Keith Rees, Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group and TV Ed Productions
results.description: Because of changing library information systems, computerised catalogues are increasingly being used to record, store and retrieve holdings in libraries. Ann Hannan demostrates how to use the OPAC (On Line Public Access Catalogue) System, which is a touch system used in public libraries.
description_for_label: Because of changing library information systems, computerised catalogues are increasingly being used to record, store and retrieve holdings in libraries. Ann Hannan demostrates how to use the OPAC (On Line Public Access Catalogue) System, which is a touch system used in public libraries.

results.title: Ost offic
results.creator_credit: Helen Grace, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Helen Grace reworks images of a disused rural post office and repurposes found footage in this poetic meditation on the fragility of civic space.
results.description: Helen Grace reworks images of a disused rural post office and repurposes found footage in this poetic meditation on the fragility of civic space.

results.title: Knit-face
results.creator_credit: Janet Merewether, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Janet Merewether’s comic portrait series of knitted dolls illuminates the unpredictable, shabby beauty of found objects and gleefully appreciates the individual, creative application of this traditional craft form.
results.description: Janet Merewether’s comic portrait series of knitted dolls illuminates the unpredictable, shabby beauty of found objects and gleefully appreciates the individual, creative application of this traditional craft form.

results.title: Fountain
results.creator_credit: Shaun Gladwell, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Featuring renowned breakdancer Morganics pulling his moves in a water fountain, Shaun Gladwell’s street-wise video ‘painting’ plays with performance, gravity and time to unsettle expectations of urban space.
results.description: Featuring renowned breakdancer Morganics pulling his moves in a water fountain, Shaun Gladwell’s street-wise video ‘painting’ plays with performance, gravity and time to unsettle expectations of urban space.

results.title: Whitefellanormal
results.creator_credit: Vernon Ah Kee, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.material_description: single channel digital video, colour, sound, 30 min duration
results.brief_description: Vernon Ah Kee’s seething representation of contemporary Australian black/white politics playfully uses language, moving text and self-portraiture to deadly serious effect.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vernon Ah Kee, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.description: Vernon Ah Kee’s seething representation of contemporary Australian black/white politics playfully uses language, moving text and self-portraiture to deadly serious effect.
